dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel Hossain 176 (104b 15x4 7x6 121m) SR: 169.23

dismissalComment.html: holes out to deep midwicket. Attempted yorker goes wrong. But it's moving in at leg stump. He can't get under it quickly enpough. Might have been looking to go over fine leg again, with a slight shuffle. Ended up cramping himself and toe-ending this to Sabbir

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 85 (92b 4x4 0x6 152m) SR: 92.39

dismissalComment.html: a wicket at last for Bangladesh. Rubel had troubled Amla in this little spell so far. This one is back of a length, slight dip inwards before straightening. Angled bat from Amla who is trying to dab it to third man. A nice, loud edge on it

a wicket at last for Bangladesh. Rubel had troubled Amla in this little spell so far. This one is back of a length, slight dip inwards before straightening. Angled bat from Amla who is trying to dab it to third man. A nice, loud edge on it

holes out to deep midwicket. Attempted yorker goes wrong. But it's moving in at leg stump. He can't get under it quickly enpough. Might have been looking to go over fine leg again, with a slight shuffle. Ended up cramping himself and toe-ending this to Sabbir

leg-bye, appeal for lbw, seems to be pitching outside leg, review on the not out call. Yorker again and its struck Duminy low on the back toe. No bat detected. Pitch map shows pitching on middle and leg and struck him in line. OUT. Decision overturned.

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Pretorius plays a lazy waft to long-off. Kayes take the catch just inside the rope.

Yes, it's a W-I-C-K-E-T! After 372 runs and 60.2 overs, Bangladesh finally manage to separate Hashim Amla and Quinton de Kock. Shakib slides it in on middle from over the wicket. De Kock plays around his front pad, misses the full, straight ball, and is trapped in front of middle. That was pretty adjacent. It would have crashed into leg stump

Bangladesh did not find a breakthrough in the first ODI, they have now struck twice in four balls. Shakib's the man. This is a beautiful delivery: liberally tossed up, drifts in on middle, then breaks away to hit the top of off stump. Faf had stayed leg side of the ball, and missed it. He has a wry smile. Shakib wheels away in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 46 (61b 1x4 0x6 78m) SR: 75.4

dismissalComment.html: Yes, it's a W-I-C-K-E-T! After 372 runs and 60.2 overs, Bangladesh finally manage to separate Hashim Amla and Quinton de Kock. dismissalText.long: c de Villiers b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c de Villiers b Imran Tahir 68 (77b 6x4 1x6 127m) SR: 88.31

dismissalComment.html: simple catch to de Villiers at extra cover. Or not, based on his reaction. Looks like he lost the ball in the crowd, but it was that soft. Didn't make a difference. A googly from Tahir, good length at off stump. He doesn't pick it and looks to flick again. Leading edge carries at knee height and there's loud roar from Tahir

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Duminy b Pretorius 60 (70b 4x4 1x6 103m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: slices it straight to point. Offcutter dug in very short outside off. He steps out and gets a fair distance away from it. Has to reach out in the end with a cut and he can't clear Duminy

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Liton has been pinned lbw. He chats with Kayes and challenges the on-field out decision. SA's players, however, are quite confident. Very full and slanting in on middle, raps the front pad in line with middle. Liton played all around it and missed the ball. Ultra Edge detects spike but it came from the ball hitting the pad. No inside snick involved. This would clatter into the middle stump. Bangladesh lose a review and Liton
clean bowled. Goes wide of the crease and zips this in from outside off, back of a length. Smashes into the leg stump at about knee height as he looks to whip this off the back foot
plumb in front. He's skiddy, this guy, and very deceptive. Length ball comes back in quickly from outside off. He looks to flick it on angle but is trapped right in front of middle
pops the middle stump. Good length ball, angled in from outside off. No feet, swings across the line and misses comprehensively

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: simple catch to de Villiers at extra cover. Or not, based on his reaction. Looks like he lost the ball in the crowd, but it was that soft. Didn't make a difference. A googly from Tahir, good length at off stump. He doesn't pick it and looks to flick again. Leading edge carries at knee height and there's loud roar from Tahir

edged and brilliantly taken by de Kock. A slider from Tahir, outside off stump. The keeper doesn't seem to have picked it. His first step is towards the leg side. The batsman, on the other hand, seems to know it's going across him. Even then, it's a poor shot with a slip in place - he's looking to run it off the outer half. De Kock gets his hands in the right place and takes the edge. Shakib walks

'mine mine mine' says Faf at extra cover before taking a simple catch. Tossed up wide outside off. He goes down the track and looks to play the slog sweep. Gets a top edge that doesn't travel too wide

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Pretorius 23 (25b 3x4 0x6 32m) SR: 92

dismissalComment.html: Pretorius wins an lbw appeal with his fourth ball! Slower, full ball from the seamer, Tamim does not spot the change-up and is struck on the flap of the back pad. Was the impact in line? The tracker might have returned umpire's call on impact

headshotImage.caption: Dane Paterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dane Paterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Paterson 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: that's it. A full, fast one at leg stump and he gets a wicket on a very average bowling day for him. Too much for Rubel

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Paterson 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 57.14

commentTextItems.html: that's it. A full, fast one at leg stump and he gets a wicket on a very average bowling day for him. Too much for Rubel

commentPostTextItems.html: 6:12pm Thanks for joining us today. We will see you for the next ODI.

AB de Villiers: I enjoyed it a lot. It's a great privilege and honour to play for the country and this was the cherry on top after the hard work I've done in the last few months. Hash gave me plenty of confidence and was the perfect person for me to be with. I had one of my best nets in Kimberly and felt really good. The 200 crossed my mind but I never think about things like that, it was only about how many balls I face at the end and get as much as possible for the team.
AB de Villiers is the Man of the MAtch

Faf du Plessis: Very good performance again. AB special today. I thought we were very good with the ball on a very good wicket. As I said on the toss, it might be a bit slow surface. Our openers assessed it well and that's what set us up. The switch there in the middle was very good. Perhaps we could have got 5-10 runs more. (laughing about his dismissal) Hash said there was no turn so I took that on and got the only one that spun all day. We are definitely going to look at giving guys opportunities in the next game - not only guys in the squad but outside as well.

Mashrafe Mortaza: AB came and took the game away from us. This could have been 310-320. We started well but Tahir's wickets put us under a lot of pressure. We all know AB is a destroyer and today he played one of his best innings. When he's in that sort of form, you have to be 100% perfect. He'll punish you otherwise and that's what happened. The luck didn't go our way too a couple of times. Our biggest problem is individuals are standing up but we're not performing collectively.

5:46pm Bangladesh started well in their chase. But 354 is too much for most teams. And it proved that way for them. The foundations was set, but you could see why the acceleration attempts were delayed. Give an opening to a team like South Africa, and you will be made to pay. That's what happened here. 162 for 2 and 249 all out. Good spells from Phehlukwayo and Pretorius, who're fighting it out for the allrouner's spot. Tahir started poorly but returned to begin the procession. A comfortably win for South Africa, set up by that devil - 176 off 104 for AB de Villiers.

commentTextItems.html: shot. Slower ball, short and on middle stump. Backs away and clubs it wide of mid-on
back of a length at leg stump, flicked on the up to midwicket
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Backs away and tries to slice it. Beaten
full and angled in at off stump from around the wicket, squeezed to deep square off the inside edge
yorker at off stump, backs away and keeps it out

headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full at off stump, backs away and drives to extra cover
yorker at leg stump, backs away and plonks the bat down. Inside edge to the fine leg boundary
short ball at a leg stump line. Makes room to play the pull, but it's too quick for him
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length, angled across off stump. Dabbed to third man
full at off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and drives to mid-off

commentTextItems.html: back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, pokes away from the body, back down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, stabs at it, gets an inside edge that lands behind the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Phehlukwayo 35 (46b 3x4 0x6 68m) SR: 76.08

commentTextItems.html: pops the middle stump. Good length ball, angled in from outside off. No feet, swings across the line and misses comprehensively
back of a length at leg stump, front leg across the body as he whips to deep square

commentPostTextItems.html: Rumplestiltskin: "I'm impressed by Lucky and Pretorius so far in their ODI careers. Pretorius is tight and chips in with wickets, while Lucky seems to have a bit more nip and x-factor about his bowling. Does more with the ball. Both can also bat, with Pretorius being better in that department. Two solid all round players being groomed. "

This is a beautiful delivery: liberally tossed up, drifts in on middle, then breaks away to hit the top of off stump. Faf had stayed leg side of the ball, and missed it. He has a wry smile. Shakib wheels away in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 85 (92b 4x4 0x6 152m) SR: 92.39

dismissalComment.html: a wicket at last for Bangladesh. Rubel had troubled Amla in this little spell so far. This one is back of a length, slight dip inwards before straightening. Angled bat from Amla who is trying to dab it to third man. A nice, loud edge on it

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel Hossain 176 (104b 15x4 7x6 121m) SR: 169.23

dismissalComment.html: holes out to deep midwicket. Attempted yorker goes wrong. But it's moving in at leg stump. He can't get under it quickly enpough. Might have been looking to go over fine leg again, with a slight shuffle. Ended up cramping himself and toe-ending this to Sabbir

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Rubel Hossain 30 (30b 0x4 1x6 62m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: leg-bye, appeal for lbw, seems to be pitching outside leg, review on the not out call. Yorker again and its struck Duminy low on the back toe. No bat detected. Pitch map shows pitching on middle and leg and struck him in line. OUT. Decision overturned.

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Dwaine Pretorius c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Pretorius plays a lazy waft to long-off. Kayes take the catch just inside the rope.

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Pretorius 23 (25b 3x4 0x6 32m) SR: 92

dismissalComment.html: Pretorius wins an lbw appeal with his fourth ball! Slower, full ball from the seamer, Tamim does not spot the change-up and is struck on the flap of the back pad. Was the impact in line? The tracker might have returned umpire's call on impact

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c de Villiers b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c de Villiers b Imran Tahir 68 (77b 6x4 1x6 127m) SR: 88.31

dismissalComment.html: simple catch to de Villiers at extra cover. Or not, based on his reaction. Looks like he lost the ball in the crowd, but it was that soft. Didn't make a difference. A googly from Tahir, good length at off stump. He doesn't pick it and looks to flick again. Leading edge carries at knee height and there's loud roar from Tahir

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Phehlukwayo 14 (12b 1x4 1x6 14m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: Liton has been pinned lbw. He chats with Kayes and challenges the on-field out decision. SA's players, however, are quite confident. Very full and slanting in on middle, raps the front pad in line with middle. Liton played all around it and missed the ball. Ultra Edge detects spike but it came from the ball hitting the pad. No inside snick involved. This would clatter into the middle stump. Bangladesh lose a review and Liton

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Duminy b Pretorius 60 (70b 4x4 1x6 103m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: slices it straight to point. Offcutter dug in very short outside off. He steps out and gets a fair distance away from it. Has to reach out in the end with a cut and he can't clear Duminy

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c †de Kock b Imran Tahir 5 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: edged and brilliantly taken by de Kock. A slider from Tahir, outside off stump. The keeper doesn't seem to have picked it. His first step is towards the leg side. The batsman, on the other hand, seems to know it's going across him. Even then, it's a poor shot with a slip in place - he's looking to run it off the outer half. De Kock gets his hands in the right place and takes the edge. Shakib walks

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Phehlukwayo 35 (46b 3x4 0x6 68m) SR: 76.08

dismissalComment.html: pops the middle stump. Good length ball, angled in from outside off. No feet, swings across the line and misses comprehensively

dismissalText.long: c du Plessis b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c du Plessis b Imran Tahir 17 (18b 2x4 0x6 25m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: 'mine mine mine' says Faf at extra cover before taking a simple catch. Tossed up wide outside off. He goes down the track and looks to play the slog sweep. Gets a top edge that doesn't travel too wide

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Phehlukwayo 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: clean bowled. Goes wide of the crease and zips this in from outside off, back of a length. Smashes into the leg stump at about knee height as he looks to whip this off the back foot

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza lbw b Phehlukwayo 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front. He's skiddy, this guy, and very deceptive. Length ball comes back in quickly from outside off. He looks to flick it on angle but is trapped right in front of middle

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed not out 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 50

headshotImage.caption: Dane Paterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dane Paterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Paterson 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: that's it. A full, fast one at leg stump and he gets a wicket on a very average bowling day for him. Too much for Rubel

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dane Paterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (602) involving teams South Africa & Bangladesh in ODIs
Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (179) for BAN, going past Shakib

stories.title: Prepared to work my way back into Test team - AB de Villiers
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Paarl
stories.seoTitle: Prepared to work my way back into Test team - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: AB de Villiers has put most of the uncertainty of the last few months behind him and said he wants to enjoy cricket in his last few years

image.caption: AB de Villiers punches with a high elbow
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers punches with a high elbow, South Africa v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Paarl, October 18, 2017

stories.title: AB de Villiers joins Gayle, Dhoni in six-hitting club
stories.subTitle: South Africa V Bangladesh, 2nd ODI , Paarl
stories.seoTitle: de Villiers joins Gayle, Dhoni in six-hitting club
stories.summary: He also becomes only the second South African after Hashim Amla to bring up 25 ODI tons

image.caption: AB de Villiers marked his return with a 68-ball hundred
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers marked his return with a 68-ball hundred, South Africa v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Paarl, October 18, 2017

stories.title: SA seal series with de Villiers' whirlwind 176
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Paarl
stories.seoTitle: South Africa seal series with de Villiers' whirlwind 176
stories.summary: His career-best ODI score and Andile Phehlukwayo's four-wicket haul ensured Bangladesh remained winless on tour

stories.title: Bangladesh's chance to salvage tough tour
